text:
Credit: Clive Mason/Getty Images Duchess Drama

Reports surfaced at the end of November that Kate and Meghan were at odds with one another. A source told Us, however, that the sister-in-laws were not in a fight. “The ‘feud’ is definitely being played up. Are they the best of friends? No. Do they speak every waking second? No. Do they hate each other? Absolutely not,” the source explained.

Feud speculation escalated after the palace confirmed Harry and Meghan were moving away from Nottingham Cottage in London to Frogmore Cottage in Windsor, England — which is further away from Kate and William’s home in Kensington Palace. Despite the move, sources maintained to Us that the two women get along. “They are two women under serious amounts of pressure, stress and under a huge spotlight that no one can relate to – they will always have a bond that no one can break.”

Another insider told Us that Meghan, who was constantly making headlines for being difficult in the British press, was “frustrated” that she couldn’t speak out and defend herself to the media. “She’s always relied on her own voice to stand up for others, and for herself. So not being able to say anything is a debilitating feeling,” the second insider said. “She’s always been so independent, her entire life, and that’s all been taken away from her. She’s always been able to clap back on social media and now she can’t.”
title: Meghan Markle, Prince Harry’s Wedding: Biggest Royal Stories of 2018

Other members of the British royal family, however, reached milestones in 2018. Prince William and Duchess Kate expanded their family and Princess Eugenie […]
